item.title: Damaged Seesaw, 3rd September
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Roseberry Place, Hackney, London

item.title: Car reg MX74 FXD parked on public road for many days with no valid MOT, 3rd September
item.description:
Car has been parked on public road for a week and hasn’t moved - it’s got no valid MOT. I am concerned this would have been dumped since this road is notorious for garages/owners dumping unused cars.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wrottesley Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive potholes and bumps in the road, 3rd September
item.description:
The cycle lane on the A202 eastbound is in need of repair from Benhill Road to Southampton Way. The most dangerous spot is around the bus stop Peckham Road / Southampton Way (Stop P). There are too many bumps and potholes to swerve safely around them while also keeping an eye on stopping buses, people in the zebra crossing, and heavy traffic. They are not clearly visible and significant enough to cause bicycle damage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned van for years, 3rd September
item.description:
Location: 211 Ilderton Road A abandoned van has been occupying a parking spot at 210 Ilderton Road for over a year, and despite numerous reports, Southwark Council has not removed it. This is taking up a valuable space that could be used by residents who are desperately looking for parking. It is baffling that the council has completely ignored these complaints. How hard is it to send someone to inspect and tow the vehicle? The next step is to contact the local media to bring attention to the issue and pressure the council to act.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 227-255, Ilderton Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet
